briefdescription.para: Linear direction, modifiable via keyboard input.
Angular direction, modifiable via keyboard input.
Twist message for publishing robot velocity.

detaileddescription.para:
Integer corresponding to ASCII value of keyboard input
This function captures user input from the keyboard without requiring Enter to be pressed. It is a modification of the function found in the teleop_twist_keyboard.cpp package.

briefdescription.para: Maps keyboard input to robot commands.

detaileddescription.para:
input
Character received from keyboard input
This function takes keyboard input and, using a switch statement, adjusts the robot's velocity and direction variables accordingly.

briefdescription.para: Captures keyboard input and computes velocity commands.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints the user instruction menu for keyboard commands, captures user keyboard input, computes the new velocity and direction commands, and then publishes a Twist message with these commands to the /cmd_vel topic.

argc
An integer argument count of the command line arguments.
argv
An argument vector of the command line arguments.
Integer 0 upon exit success.
This function initializes the ROS node, advertises the /cmd_vel topic, and then enters a loop where it continually captures user input and calculates and publishes new velocity commands.

briefdescription.para: Allows manual control of the robot using keyboard input.

detaileddescription.para:
The node enables the user to move the robot in the environment using the keyboard. The velocity and direction of the robot are managed by four variables, two for velocity values (linear and angular) and two for direction (linear and angular).
